Detailed Description

Purpose: To perform huffman encoding and fast decoding.

File: UHuffman.h Author: Kevin Bray Created: 10-03-08 Copyright © 2005 Bootstrap Studios project includes. class UHuffman

Member Function Documentation

void UHuffman::BuildDecompFastTables ( unsigned char *  symTable,
unsigned char *  lenTable,
unsigned char *  rareSymTable,
unsigned short *  maxCodeTable,
unsigned char *  rareCodeOffsetTable,
const unsigned char *  codeLengths 
)

builds the tables for use with SetDecompFastTables. If you have multiple streams that use the same decompression tree, then it's advantageous to call this function once, and then use the tables with the SetDecompStreamFast() function over several function calls. This can save a lot of redundant calculations. Note that SetDecompFastTables() does not have to be called after calling this function unless SetDecompStream() is called, or this function is called with a different set of codeLengths.

build the decompression tables.

copy the data to the tables provided.

Definition at line 329 of file UHuffman.cpp.

void UHuffman::CalcCodeLengths ( unsigned char *  codeLengths,
const unsigned int *  scores 
)

This function takes a set of 256 scores (one for each of the 256 characters) and generates code lengths for them. Note that any entries that have a score of 0 must not be passed to any of the compression functions. This same set of codeLengths must be passed to the decompression routines.

Note that this function is not fast. It can be optimized greatly if needed.

build a huffman tree and use the depth of a character in the tree as it's code length.

fill out leaves.

build the tree.

calculate the total number of leaves.

initialize unused codes to zero.

if there is only one node, set it's value to 1 and return.

build the queue.

build the tree.

set the left node.

set the right node.

calculate the score for the current branch.

insert the new node and advance to the next free branch.

now calculate code lengths.

traverse up the tree to determine it's depth (and subsequently the length of the huffman code).

make sure that the tree doesn't have codes with more than 16-bits as it will break our decoding algorithm.

store the length in the output array.

Definition at line 162 of file UHuffman.cpp.

void UHuffman::CalcCodeLengths ( unsigned char *  codeLengths,
const unsigned char *  srcData,
unsigned int  srcSize 
)

compression methods

This method must be called before calling SetCompStream. This same data must be passed to the decompression methods before decompressing an encoded bit stream.

Note that this function is not fast. It can be optimized greatly if needed.

compute the current score.

now calculate code lengths using the other variant of this function.

unsigned int UHuffman::Compress ( unsigned char *  result,
unsigned char *  codeLengths,
const void *  srcData,
unsigned int  srcSize 
)

public methods

build bit codes and compresses the given sequence of bytes. Result should be the size of the data passed in. The total number of bits in the sequence is returned.

get the source.

build the code length table.

set the outgoing stream data.

write out each value.

finish writing and return the total number of bits written.

Definition at line 104 of file UHuffman.cpp.

unsigned int UHuffman::Decompress ( unsigned char *  result,
const unsigned char *  codeLengths,
const void *  compressedData,
unsigned int  srcBits 
)

uses the given code lengths to build a dictionary and decompress the data passed in. The return value is the total number of bytes in the result. Note that you have to know the size of the result buffer ahead of time. Note that this function trashes the current stream state.

set the stream data.

use the stream functions.

return the total number of bytes decompressed.

Definition at line 298 of file UHuffman.cpp.

unsigned int UHuffman::GetValueLen ( unsigned char  value  )  const

returns the length of compressed bitcode (in bits) for the value specified. This function is useful for determining the total size of compressed data before actually compressing the data.

void UHuffman::SetDecompStreamFast ( const unsigned char *  compressedData,
unsigned int  srcBitCount 
)

sets the stream for decompression and uses the supplied tables to decompress the data. You must call BuildDecompTables, SetDecompFastTables, or SetDecompStream before calling this function.
